paper_metadata.title: Impact of Ghana's Livelihood Empowerment Against Poverty (LEAP) programme on household food security in the Tolon District of the Northern Region

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: Cash transfer programmes such as Ghana's Livelihood Empowerment Against Poverty (LEAP) have been identified as a strategy for poverty reduction among poor households

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: Food security indicators were computed using consumption expenditure on food (Adult equivalent), Household Dietary Diversity Score (HDDS), and Household Food Insecurity Access Scale (HFIAS)
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: An Endogenous Switching Regression (ESR) model was used to estimate the effects of participation in the LEAP programme on household food security

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: Cash transfer programmes such as Ghana's Livelihood Empowerment Against Poverty (LEAP) have been identified as a strategy for poverty reduction among poor households
evidence_citations.country_citation: Cash transfer programmes such as Ghana's Livelihood Empowerment Against Poverty (LEAP) have been identified as a strategy for poverty reduction among poor households
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: The LEAP programme is focussed on addressing the health, education, and consumption needs of households
